Reviews.Title: “Good but could do better”
Reviews.Author: Zouls
Reviews.Content: That is the common refrain for this aparthotel. The location is good in terms of convenience for sight-seeing and there is a certain aura about staying so close to the forum et al (walking past the forum every night on your way home!). It's about 10 minutes walk from the nearest metro station (Circus Maximus) but that's as much to do with the city's limited metro system as anything else. The rooms have mostly been recently renovated and are of a good size. The bathrooms are large and have the biggest sink you will ever find. I was staying on the top floor so got a balcony with a good view of the Forum and Palatine Hill. There was no noise from outside, although being at the top and in the opposite corner from the street it may not mean much. The lobby and corridors are very sleek and a bit lacking in character, which is a bit jarring considering all the ancient landmarks surrounding it. Breakfast is decent, but not really what you would expect from somewhere for this price. The staff are friendly and helpful, especially the ladies at breakfast. The only problem is, you will probably encounter various small problems that shouldn't take much to be fixed, but have already been listed by previous reviewers. Breakfast, while decent enough, is inferior compared to other places around Italy that are a lot cheaper. There's no washing up products to clean your dishes from day to day. I wasn't eating in much so it didn't become a big issue but why has such a basic thing been overlooked? Everything is very sleek and modern, but there's a lack of charm to it. Wifi is not free, even though even B&B's these days are sometimes able to offer it, let alone a luxury sort of hotel like this. The key to the room is a massive metal "tube" that not only takes a lot of space in your pocket but also weighs an absurd amount when it's just a key. It's just not sensible or practical. There's a number of little things like this that others have commented on that leave you regularly thinking "this should be better". It's a shame because the rooms are excellent otherwise and they've got good enough staff and an excellent location. It's like management is penny pinching or trying to cut corners when the gains are negligible compared to the downsides. In terms of value for money, it's ok but not great. The rooms are certainly worth it, but the various nagging issues make it hard to justify spending the extra €40-50 compared to other accomodation in Rome. If they can just focus on the details and get everything up to the same standard as the rooms and staff then it would be an excellent place to stay. As it is, I'm not sure I would choose to stay here again, at least not without giving other places a try first. It's a shame, because with the right approach this could be excellent all around.

Reviews.Title: “I would certainly stay there again”
Reviews.Author: travelpig_9
Reviews.Content: A modernised building several hundred years old which is converted into suites. Walking distance (About 1/2 a mile) from the forum and Collosseum. There are a couple of restaurants within about 150yds. Internet access and Wifi is available for a small fee. Bathrooms look a bit chewed as they have used chipboard which has soaked up the moisture and split soon after installation. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Breakfast served till 11 is continental simple but adequate and may not suit the fry-up fans. There are no kettles but a pan of water works fine in the small kitchen area. Some rooms have great views and others look out onto a wall. Traffic noise is very noticeable but not excessive. There is a fitness suite if you have energy left after touring the sights. Taken as a whole, I liked it.

Reviews.Title: “getting better”
Reviews.Author: Mick M
Reviews.Content: Just back from 5 days at the hotel. Location could not be better for the ancient attractions. I must admit I was tentative in booking this as some previous 'Trip Advisor' comments were not positive. However I can say that the staff were excellent, nothing was a problem from daily checking the up to date weather, directions to restaurants etc. The breakfasts were good (for a continental style) and everything replenished if needed - this had been highlighted as a problem previously - no absolutely fine. The size of our room was very good (room 13) with separate bedroom and lounge (with kitchenette behind a folding screen). Our only adverse comment would be that the room needs a refresh (update) as the bathroom unit surfaces were worn/craked and also the kitchenette units/drawers. However this was a minor - cant realy call it a problem, but still not good for a £200 per night 'luxury' apparthotel. All in all we would return.

Reviews.Title: “location vs amenities”
Reviews.Author: cecillie
Reviews.Content: On the plus side:Palazzo al Velabro is in a good location for seeing most of the sights of Rome, though a few are quite a hike. We found the breakfast to be quite good, decent choices. The staff is accommodating and very friendly. Most rooms have been updated. The suites are spacious but the hotel is starkly modern, so if you're looking for cozy, forget it. In the minus column: The kitchen/sitting area of our suite had a distinctly smoky smell, had to keep the a/c running full blast to keep the air circulating. The amenities are lacking, no tissues, "bath" towels are oversized hand towels and we had to ask for more as there were only 2. The shower curtain in the half-width tub is fabric,we had wet floor with every shower. The mattress seems to be a bottom-of-the-line basic spring mattress, quite uncomfortable. There is no WiFi, you can use the computer in the lobby area but you pay by the minute and need your own source such as a laptop or smart phone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Elisabeth1955
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here with our adult daughter for the last 7 days of a month long Europe trip and were delighted with everything about this hotel. The staff were so helpful and gave us lots of useful advice and the location was outstanding close to many important Roman ruins and sights. Our apartment which consisted of 2 connecting suites on the 4th floor was very spacious and light with 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, 2 kitchens, lounge room, dining area and entrance hall. It was clean, modern and very comfortable and great value for money considering what we had paid for accomodation in other European destinations. We will certainly be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay. Central, clean and friendly. I would definitely recommend it!!”
Reviews.Author: Docron4284
Reviews.Content: Lovely restaurant right behind the hotel with discount when recommended by the hotel. Easy access to the historic areas of Rome. Ten minute walkl to the forum. Lovely decor in recently remodeled hotel. Breakfast was very good with lots of variety.

Reviews.Title: “A basic hotel/ timeshare”
Reviews.Author: BayAreaRes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel through the Royal Holiday timeshare. We got a 1 bedroom unit on the 2nd floor, which was very spacious. The hotel is quite quiet, a little out of the way, except to go to Trastevere neighborhood. It is close to the river (Tiber) and can walk across to all the restaurants and shops in Trastevere, it is bus ride from most of the sights. The front desk staff is polite and helpful. We had to pay extra for the breakfast, but I think it is because we got it as a timeshare, if you are a hotel guest, I believe breakfast is included. Breakfast is ok, fruit, cereal, cold cuts, pastries. They have hard boiled eggs, but ran out by 9 a.m. one morning. The fruit bowl is somewhat limited, but at least fresh fruit instead of canned stuff that some other hotels sometimes offer. The hotel is a little dated. We were on the 2nd floor, and the room was a little ragged, didn't feel clean. We had a cot as an extra bed (even though we asked for a fold out couch), it was incredibly short. I'm a relatively short person, and even then, my feet were sticking out at the end of the bed. For the price, I think the hotel is fine, but it is no more than a 3 stars, that's for sure.

Reviews.Title: “+ 4th floor - INCREDIBLE apartments, views, - breakfast”
Reviews.Author: shinjodenn
Reviews.Content: This place is weird. If you stay on floors 1-3, not only do you pay less, but your apartment is a bit outdated and, well, not so great. If you stay on floors 4-5, you pay more, but your apartment is remodeled (2009), and, well, GREAT! The apartments vary in range and are about 50 square meters each. The views on the side of the Forum are to die for and they go quickly. We had a living room with eat in kitchen with a flat panel TV that moved out at 90° from the wall - convenient when the couch was set at 90° from the TV. The water in the fridge is yours for free (oooh) and the robes (without hoods) and slippers (small - like Italian feet) are not for yours to keep. The bedroom is large and weirdly, only there do you have Sky with another flat panel TV. The bad. I am NOT the first to mention this, but the breakfast is an absolute joke. I mean, if this is a 4 star hotel/residence, what are they doing serving tiny, not very tasty pastries and that's about it! The juices are in these quite elegant silver decanters, but with NO LABELS you have no idea what is inside - pour and DISCOVER! There is fresh bread (good), but the selection of jams is bad, bad, bad. There was a crostata that looked good, but I didn't have it. There was also real fresh fruit salad - good, but when it ran out ... that was it ... no more fresh fruit salad. There was also some yogurt and small boxes of Kellogs brand cereal. Then there were two bottles of water. That's it. Breakfast is served! I hope this description gives you the idea that their breakfast was of the 2 star quality, not 4 star quality that they have been awarded. Last complete was our check-in. I travel allot and when you have to leave your documents so that the check-in can enter your passport or identity card information - YOU LEAVE THOSE DOCUMENTS and the check-in clerk gives you the key to the apartment and when you come down to the lobby later they give you back the documents. THAT IS THE WAY YOU DO IT! You do NOT make your customer wait while you enter the ID information (complete with grumbling about how the computer wasn't working). When I asked the clerk (in Italian) if we could get the keys to our room and go he said, "I'm entering your document information." Thanks, I know that, but you DON'T do it this way.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable central location at reasonable rates”
Reviews.Author: burtonnju
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have asked for a more convenient location for touring ancient Rome. The hotel is clean and modern with an attentive, friendly staff, available 24 hours. Walter at the front desk is very helpful. He promptly attended to all our requests and made suggestions and arrangements for places to visit. The hotel is in a perfect location, close to points of interest, accessible by buses and trains nearby. Very highly recommended for anyone visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for discovering Rome”
Reviews.Author: kerrydean62
Reviews.Content: This superb hotel is in a great location for walking to all the must see sights in Rome, close to buses to anywhere in the city and just across the road to the river and a lovely little park with it's own 2000 year old temples!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay with super staff”
Reviews.Author: Skimeup
Reviews.Content: This is an extremely nice place to stay though somewhat out of the way. I stayed here with my cousin through a timeshare exchange and I would highly recommend it to others for exchange or rental. We were in a one bedroom unit, with a wonderful large king sized bed in the bedroom and a pull out loveseat in the living room, both of which were extremely comfortable. There was plenty of dresser and closet space and a very convenient safe. The entire hotel has been recently renovated and it feels and looks fresh and new. The kitchen facility is definitely minimalist, with no microwave and a tiny bar type refrigerator. There is a small two burner cookstove, and a couple of pots and pans and some dishware. No microwave but a small dishwasher. We make tea every night and generally snack on cheese and such so we didn’t need much but still we used the kitchen. There was no dishwashing material and when I requested it, I got a large container of liquid detergent and an old sponge with a scrubby. Well, it did the job… There is a very nice HD TV set but it gets only Italian TV – no CNN or BBC news, so of limited use to English speakers. Wireless internet costs E9 per day, which seems a bit much. It really seems as if internet should be like a TV and such - just a standard part of the accommodation but not so here. The front desk staff is really super friendly and helpful and they all speak perfect English. They are happy to be helpful about arranging taxis and such and will cheerfully look up information for you about various goings on. The hotel is near the river and the old, historic section of town. It is a goodly distance from the train station and a hike to the metro, but many buses run on the street nearby. Its location is a bit obscure when you first arrive – it is up the steps from a historic arch or approachable on a cobblestone road that is often blocked by parked cars. You can get bus information from the maps or buy a bus map from a tobacco stand. Everyone likes to tell you in Italy that the bus maps are changing but since everything is printed on old signs at the bus stops that don’t seem to change, I think they just don’t want to give away free maps when they are being sold at local stands. The tourist information stand outside the Termini is friendly and helpful and the hotels and TI have excellent free maps and you can rely on them for good information and the bus info on those maps worked just fine. Breakfast is served daily at the hotel – it was not included in my rate and after I checked it out, I did not think it was worth E12.5 per day. There just seemed to be some coffee and a few pastries. There is not much to eat very close by. Around the corner up the hill is a farmer’s market and there are some sandwich/pastry shops and such in walking distance, but you must really cross the Tiber and wander into the Trastavere to find a decent restaurant – that is an easy walk but you do have to brave several busy Rome streets without the help of traffic lights! The fitness center was nice and had a decent choice of machines.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: fififa
Reviews.Content: The staff at Residence Palazzo Al Velabro is extremely friendly. The lobby of the hotel is modern and updated and the room is pretty clean. Unfortunately they were a little stingy with the toiletries. We had go to the lobby and asked for them every time we ran out.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all round!”
Reviews.Author: ChristieMidlands
Reviews.Content: This is like an aparthotel - we had a deluxe double apartment and it was very good indeed. Altho' the building is old, it has been refurbished and is very modern inside. The apartment had a lounge/kithenette/dining table, bathroom and good sized bedroom. Very comfortable. It's really useful to have the extra facilities compared to a hotel room. It's ideal for the ancient Roman sites - walking distance. The 110 tourist bus stops close by. There are restaurants within walking distance and a wonderful deli/shop a few minutes stroll. Obviously, the choice of restaurants is not as good as some other areas but we found it fine. What makes this hotel stand out are the people - everyone was really helpful and friendly. Reception staff speak excellent English and were very efficient and helpful both before we arrived with our queries and then the whole time we were there. Full marks! We booked our airport transfers through the hotel too and these were spot on. All in all, a really good palce to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Hervik
Reviews.Content: A modern and comfortable residence hotel with spacious rooms. Friendly and serviceminded personnel. A nice and convenient location for those who do not fancy jet set/disco and shopping. Close to Capitol and Palatino makes it the perfect starting point for visit to these "must see" places.

Reviews.Title: “best deal in Rome. Clean, modern, air conditioned serviced apartment”
Reviews.Author: gmgOc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this service apartment 5 years ago and thought it was great. I love staying at serviced apartments if I can find one. A few years ago we stayed here with my family of 5 in adjoining 1 bedroon and studio. We had plenty of space and could make a little food in the kitchenette. The Palazzo was remodeled last year and is now fantastic. This year we stayed with another couple and each of us had one bedrooms overlooking an old stone arch. The rooms are large, modern, well air conditioned and quiet . The concierge was helpful in getting ticket. included in the room rental is the indoor gym, which my husband enjoyed and a light breakfast. The location is convenient as you can walk to the forum, the Trevi fountain and Trastavere. For the price of a hotel room you get a very nice suite. it is the best deal in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “I cannot recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: whatsinaname50
Reviews.Content: Where to start... We had one of our worst experiences staying in this hotel. The room we were assigned to was not at all like the pictures provided. Maybe some of the rooms in the hotel where renovated but certainly not the one we stayed in. Our room was dark, depressing and extremely outdated and old. The carpet was thread bare and the beds were rock hard. I have never slept on such a hard, unappealing bed in my life. The bathroom was also outdated and had noticeable mould between the mirror and the wall. We asked the front desk immediately to change or upgrade our room. On our initial day and each day after we were told that the hotel was full. My son was given a tiny cot to sleep on for 4 nights. He is 6 foot. There is no way that the room we were given would accommodate 4 adults....let alone 3. We found a sewing needle in the carpet by the bed that luckily no one in my family stepped on. We were given one bar of tiny soap for 3 people for 4 nights. When I inquired if we could have a second bar for the bath I was told that that is not their policy. One night a light in my sons sleeping/living area malfunctioned (it lit up the room every 2- 4 minutes). Upon calling the front desk at 1:00 am and then finally dressing and going down to the front desk at 3:00 am we finally had the desk clerk correct the situation (he put a chair on the table and unscrewed the light bulb.....never to replace it while we were there) We felt at times like we were imposing as we were "timeshare" guest. The breakfast consisted....daily...of stale cereal, dry cakes and fruit. On our last morning, upon check-out we were given a bill for 84.00 Euros for breakfast. Naturally I tried to argue but too no avail. I was led to believe that breakfast was included. They said simply to "take our complaint to Royal Holiday". I could never have imagined a worse experience than the one we encountered. Luckily Rome was both beautiful and fascinating. After our stay in Rome we travelled to Florence, Venice, Innsbruck, Munich and Frankfurt. At no time did we encounter such poor service, terrible and inadequate breakfast and deplorable accommodations

Reviews.Title: “a well located refuge in the heart of busy Rome”
Reviews.Author: khbcal
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here in a junior suite. The hotel has been recently updated and is very chic and modern in its decor. the rooms are large by european standards and our room as I believe most had a small kitchenette which is nice when you don't want to have to venture out every night to eat. The facilities are limited - a nice breakfast bar and a fitness room. Was disappointed that for the price wireless internet was extra. The service was superb and english capable. This hotel is located within minutes of Capitol Hill and the forum/colosseum/ palantine hill. We walked everywhere including to the Vatican which was a nice stroll up the river. There were a couple of nice little trattoria and bar up the street. Not a cheap stay but a great place to come back to after soaking up the sights and streets of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay while in the Eternal City”
Reviews.Author: rakurz
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Rome where I stayed at this property. It is a little hard to find at first, but once you know where it is, it is actually in a great location. You can walk about 3 blocks to get to the Colosseum and the Ancient City. Or go a few blocks in the other direction and you are in the Jewish section of town, or in Trastevere. The metro stop at the Circus Maximus is very close also, giving you full, easy access to the whole city. We had a one bedroom unit on the second floor. The room was very nicely appointed, with a big living/dining room, a kitchen, and a separate bedroom. There was plenty of closet space for our clothes (something you can't always say in a hotel in Europe). The staff was incredible, helping us out with any and everything. My only complaint would be about the internet service. It is provided by a third party and cost 22 Euros per day. That is an absolutely ridiculous daily cost. I highly recommend this place and the staff at this hotel. Loved loved loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, needs updating”
Reviews.Author: Lila131
Reviews.Content: We reserved a 3 room apartment for 3 nights because we wanted to have some extra room. The place was very large-- a bedroom; a living area with a 4 person dining table and kitchenette; and another room with a desk, sofa bed and small balcony. Both the bedroom and living area had TVs. The room overlooked Palantine Hill and a beautiful garden which belongs an adjacent building. Unfortunately, the decor was 60's and 70's so quite ugly; however, the place was spotlessly clean. The kitchenette would be useful only for the use of the fridge and to use the dishes for carry out food. The bed was rather hard but not horrible. The location was good. About 10-15 minutes walk to the entrance of the Colusseum, Forum/Palantine Hill and Circus Maximus; about 30 minutes to the Vatican and about 30 minutes to the Trevi Fountain and Spanish steps areas. Also, the Trastavere area with many restaurants is only about 10-15 minutes away across the river. It was very quiet at night. The hotel was doing some major remodeling on the floor below us but the workers never disturbed us at all. The staff members at the hotel were pleasant, friendly and very helpful, all speaking fluent English. If you need a lot of room and don't care about the decor, I would recommend this hotel/apartment house.

Reviews.Title: “The Palazzo Al Velabro was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: caiogirl
Reviews.Content: THE VELABRO was great for location, accommodations and staff. These are not rooms but suites, like small apartments, created out of a former palace We had a bedroom, living room-dining room combo with a kitchenette, a bathroom, 3 closets and a balcony. The balcony was off the bedroom which had a bureau, lounge chair, and a TV, and very comfortable bed. The view of the balcony faced into the flowering meditation garden of the church next door and the back of the Palatine Hill, lovely esp. for a drink before dinner. The balcony had flowering plants and a small table with iron chairs. There were sheers as well as draw-able drapes on the balcony windows. The DR-LR had a sofa and chairs, a desk and an entry table as well as a full dining set, and a tall draped window. The kitchenette was complete with stove, small fridge, sink, coffee pot and and sufficient basic utensils etc to do a full meal. The furnishings were not worn; everything was nicely kept up except for one small worn carpet area on a threshold. The bathroom had a tub and shower, as well as a large counter area and a "medicine" cabinet and below sink cabinet plus a full mirror. It is located across the street from the Bucca Veritas, with a tour bus stop, and one block from the Forum in one direction and the Circus Maximus in the other. It is about 3 blocks from the Coliseum and a one block to the Tiber River. There are numerous restaurants about 2-3 blocks away near the Victor Emmanuel building and a state museum. The staff was most friendly and helpful and always willing to assist. They let us store some of our luggage while we went to Sorrento and Capri for 3 nights. Breakfast is available , including coffees, teas, cold cereals, fresh and dried fruit, and baked goods We were 2 couples and both had the same positive stay in each of our suites, one on the 2nd floor and one on the 5th. One caution...in late April/ early May, the birds which nest on the roof are very territorial and objected strenuously to 5th floors tenants being on their balcony which faced the street. I thought I had written this review earlier but realize that I just responded directly to one person's inquiry. We liked it so much that we will be back this winter! PS the photos at the website are very accurate.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, you must stay here”
Reviews.Author: Skyes10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I really loved staying at this hotel for a number of reasons. Firstly, the extra space. Having an apartment was luxurious, we had a living area with kitchen, dining and lounge, then a separate bedroom, great size bathroom and a small little balcony. Secondly, the location was excellent, we walked to every tourist destination. First day we walked to Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps etc. Second day we did the Vatican (was an hour walk but along the water so was quite nice). Third day we did the Colosseum (which is closest to the hotel). Capitol hill with great buildings are also nearby. We would walk in the mornings, come back for a rest and then go to the Jewish quarter for dinner. Very safe area. There is a small corner store with snacks and wine, but not much else. We found a street cart nearby that sold cheese and tomato panini's and we'd have that for breakfast. We picked up some groceries when we went to Trevi fountain, so were able to have eggs, bread etc. The thing we appreciated the most was the helpful concierge. We didn't get his name, but he was a younger guy with a beard. He was so helpful and did everything to make our stay so easy. Definitely the best service we experienced on our Italian holiday. If you want a bit of extra space (rare in Rome) and want to be able to walk to all the destinations and still be away from all the hype and noise, this is your hotel. The only thing we would change on our trip is we would make reservations for the Vatican before we got to Rome! I'd make it for anytime after 11 to avoid the opening time line up. We had to line up for 3 hours and when we got to the gate, the reservation line was nearly empty. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Hard, hard beds”
Reviews.Author: movingon42
Reviews.Content: The Velabros bed's are like sleeping on a block of granite. I have never had to deal with such a hard bed. The sofa was hard too. There was no place to rest easy and get comfortable. The laundry service lost our laundry too. Other than than, what is not to love about the Velabro. The rooms were attractive, the staff was wonderful but when you can't sleep because the bed is so hard why on earth would you want to stay there. I wouldn't recommend this hotel unless you really love a rock hard mattress.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: PT-ST
Reviews.Content: It was extremely hot during our stay in Rome (37+C) and our air conditioned room and the always helpful and very pleasant staff at the Velabro were a very welcome sight at the end of long days sightseeing. Huge room, very neat and tidy with all facilities and while carpet showed some wear, we certainly had no complaints. The balcony and the view overlooking the Palatine Hill were a wonderful bonus when things cooled down at night. The staff could not do enough for us from restaurant advice and reservations to organising affordable airport transfers. Great location and lots of very good restaurants and bars in the adjacent Jewish Quarter or a short walk to cross the Tiber into the heart of Rome's restaurant area, Travestere. Would happily base ourselves here again to further enjoy all that Rome has to offer PT - Australia

Reviews.Title: “Unsurpassed -- XOXOXOXOX to Velabro!”
Reviews.Author: LaVida
Reviews.Content: I searched countless hotels to find the right place to stay with my family in Rome for a few weeks. My husband needed reliable internet access to keep in touch with work and we needed space that we could share with our 2 boys. I found the right place with this hotel and I can't say enough good things about it. The management, the four folks who work at the desk, and the housekeepers -- each and every one of them -- make it an absolutely fantastic place to stay. Two of the folks working at the desk have been at Velabro for more than 20 years (one for 30). That says alot about the hotel. We've traveled around the world and stayed in 5 star hotels most of the time, including Park Hyatt, Four Seasons, Mandarin Oriental, and most recently, San Clemente Palace in Vienna. None of them have better service than this hotel -- the attitude at Velabro is welcoming, helpful, and beyond comparision. It's refreshing to be served by staff who do not constantly have their hands out for tips but instead simply consider it their job to make sure you are comfortable. They notice everything you need and respond without you asking. It's a small community that is very positive and professional. The hotel has one common entrance that is locked but monitored continuously to let in guests as they walk up. Even after my husband left, and I stayed for several weeks here alone with my young children, I felt very safe -- and very cared for. I can't begin to detail the things this hotel did for us. The wonderful fresh hot chocolate for the boys in the morning, the free videos for them to watch in the room (in English), or the endless bandaids and antiseptic they applied to the boys "hurts" from the streets of Rome -- it was wonderful. Each person who works here is cheerful, anticipates your needs before you ask ,and gives above and beyond. You literally feel at home. Each person we ran into at this hotel is a genuinely good person and genuinely enjoys other people. The apartments are spacious. There is a kitchenette with dishes and linens and they even supplied dishwashing liquid. There is plenty of space in the refrigerator for you to stock it yourself. If you use the drinks, etc. that the hotel supplies, they don't price gouge. Don't worry about the lack of room service. You have your own kitchen. There is a great market around the corner with fresh baked bread, fresh top quality produce, and cold cuts. Also, in the evening, folks at the desk ordered food for us from a great local restaurant at extremely reasonable prices. If you are rude and demanding, upset by small things that don't matter (like shower curtains), don't stay here. This hotel is not for you. If you love life and people and you appreciate the things that really matter, there can be no better place than Velabro. This hotel is clean, safe, and dependable. It's professional, reliable, and unsurpassed. If I lived in Rome, I can think of no better place to live than to live in this hotel. (And, actually, I'm pretty picky and demanding). XOXOXOXOXOXOXOXOX to Velabro!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: arandle
Reviews.Content: My family (4 adults) spent 5 nights here in March 2007, and were rapt with the accommodation. We had booked a two bedroom apartment, and expected to find a single apartment with two bedrooms. Instead, we were delighted to find two separate apartments with a common front door. Each apartment had a huge living area, a kitchenette (fridge and cook top), bathroom (with bathtub/shower and beday), bedroom (with TV), 2 large closets and a safe deposit box. The front desk staff (especially Luigi and Walter) were excellent. They were kind enough to book taxis for us, recommend modes of transport to/from our destinations, and help order our meals over the phone (in Italian). Our booking included breakfast, which was served (buffet style) in a small room next to the front desk. Pastries, cereal, fresh fruit, juices, coffee/tea were continually restocked, and were absolutely delicious. Conveniently located next to the Roman Forum, the Residence Palazzo Al Velabro was a 10 min taxi ride to the Spanish Steps, 15 min taxi ride to the Vatican, and a 20 min walk across the bridge to Trastevere. The only drawbacks were the shower curtain (which stuck to you when having a shower), and the absence of a clock and a dishwasher. Overall, the accommodation was fantastic and we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: cordelia11
Reviews.Content: We were seeking an apartment for the convenience of a kitchen and a living room for a vacation that took place over New Years Eve. While the apartment could use some updating, the place was comfortable for us. We were on the second floor with a view of the back garden, and the Palatine Hill. We were pleased with how quiet it was at night, in spite of all the traffic noise in Rome. Off the tourist track - but still close to all the interesting areas. The apartment was clean, although thread-worn, and it was refreshed daily. The kitchen was missing wine glasses and an oven would have been nice - but it wasnt necessary. The bathroom really was the biggest disappointment - it was in real need of renovation, and was uncomfortable since it had a strong draft that blew cold air on your feet when stepping out of the narrow shower. But, there was plenty of hot water, and clean towels provided every day. The staff was pleasant and helpful. A bottle of champagne was delivered to our room on New Years Eve - that was a nice surprise. The location was close enough to restaurants, with a small store and coffee shop very close by. You cant beat the location - just a few minutes walk from the Forum.

Reviews.Title: “Some good, some not so good”
Reviews.Author: Debkatie
Reviews.Content: Our family of six stayed here for the convenience of having a kitchen and more room to spread out in. One of the units we had was a little run down -- plaster coming off the walls and the covering on the bathroom walls was literally separating at the seams. The other room we had seemed better. Sorry I don't remember the room numbers to warn which one to avoid, except the not so great one was on the main floor. The hotel could use a little cleaning too. The location is pretty good-- near the Roman Forum; and we could walk everywhere else in Rome. There are several little restaurants and bars in the area, vegetable stores, etc. One additional note: we found the beds uncomfortable -- either new mattresses are in order or Romans like sleeping on rock. If you are traveling with a family and need an apartment, this will do, just ask for a renovated room....

Reviews.Title: “Great location, spacious views, great views”
Reviews.Author: lgalvin
Reviews.Content: This apartment house is adjacent to the forum. As apartmetns, the rooms are equipped with kitchens, table, large bed, closets and bathrooms, as well as full balconies overlooking their landscaped gardens and the forum. I also loved the huge bath towels. It is a short walk to the forum, Colosseum, circus maximus, the Tiber, and as the previous reviewer wrote, easy to catch the bus into central Rome or out to Carcalla baths or the catacombs. It was perfectly quiet at night, a plus in a busy city like Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved the Palazoo al Velabro. The staff provided a very high level of service and were always friendly and informative. The room was spotless and had a very large bathroom with plenty of hot water. It is extremely close to the Roman Forum and the rest of Rome is very reachable by bus. Buses pass very frequently in front of the hotel so getting around is not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Grreat value and location”
Reviews.Author: RuthMc
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 nights here in May 2005. Arrived to discover that I had failed to change our reserved dates and the hotel expected us a week earlier. They couldn't have been nicer about it, found us a suite and didn't charge us for the missed night. We had a 2 room suite, living area with kitchenette and bedroom. Kitchen had 4 burner cooktop, small frig & microwave. Lots of dishes, although no wineglasses--kind of odd for Italy. Bed was 2 twins pushed together, but comfortable with nightstands and lamps on both sides. Tv in bedroom with VCR player, although we never used that feature. Loads of closet space in our unit. Three big windows that opened and views over the piazza. We were told we had a very nice apartment, so the others may not have the same window setup. The carpet and upholstery are old but that didn't detract from the comfort. The bathroom had a tub and "american-type" shower--hurray! Tub somewhat narrow, so the curtain liked to attach itself to you, but only a small problem. There is a small terazza on the first (second American) floor with three tables so you can sit outside. Our room had a safe deposit box. Liked the accessibility from the location. Nice little bar around the corner for delicious morning cappuchino. Easy to get to Trastevere (used the bridges over the island so you can get traffic lights to cross the road along the Tiber) and the Jewish Ghetto. We walked everywhere (including the Vatican) except the Borghese Gallery. All in all, a great experience and I'd not hesitate to recommend it to anyone.

HotelInfo.Name: Residence Palazzo Al Velabro
HotelInfo.Address: Via del Velabro 16, 00186 Rome, Italy
